name: Easy Please Punctuate! Trivia Quiz | Quiz Creation Guidelines | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: Quizzyland is a great place to play trivia games.
options: Quizzyland is a great place to play trivia games
Quizzyland, is a great place to play trivia games.
Quizzyland is a great place to play, trivia games.
questions.explanation:
Quizzyland is a great place to play trivia games.

	This is a plain old sentence:  one idea, no commas, one period.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: Although I also visit Amazon.com, Quizzyland is my favorite site.
options: Although I also visit Amazon.com, Quizzyland is my favorite site
Although I also visit Amazon.com Quizzyland is my favorite site.
Although, I also visit Amazon.com, Quizzyland is my favorite site.
questions.explanation:
Although I also visit Amazon.com, Quizzyland is my favorite site.

	A good rule-of-thumb about commas is that they go where you would take a breath or a pause if you were speaking. Try saying both the correct and incorrect answers this way and you'll see what I mean.None of the incorrect answers are identical to the correct one. One is missing a period at the end of the sentence. One is missing a comma after "com." One has an extra comma after "Although."

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: Quizzyland has many quizzes. Education is my favorite category.
options: Quizzyland has many quizzes, Education is my favorite category.
Quizzyland has many quizzes.Education is my favorite category.
Quizzyland has many quizzes Education is my favorite category.
questions.explanation:
Quizzyland has many quizzes. Education is my favorite category.

	You need to put a space after a period. These are two separate ideas, so they are two separate sentences.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: I'd like it if you played my quiz.
options: I'd like it if you played my quiz?
I'd like it if you played my quiz
I'd like it if you played, my quiz...
questions.explanation:
I'd like it if you played my quiz.

	This is just a regular old sentence, so it needs a regular old period at the end.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
options: You must play, my quiz!
You must play my quiz
You must, play my quiz!
questions.explanation:
You must play my quiz!.

	An exclamation point is appropriate here because a strong feeling is being conveyed. There is only one idea in this sentence, so no commas are necessary.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
options: Who wrote this silly quiz.
Who wrote this silly quiz!
Who, wrote this silly quiz?
questions.explanation:
Who wrote this silly quiz?.

	It's a question, so it needs a question mark. It's just one idea, so no commas.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: I like editing quizzes. I do it all day long.
options: I like editing quizzes.I do it all day long.
I like editing quizzes I do it all day long.
I like editing. Quizzes. I do it all day long.
questions.explanation:
I like editing quizzes. I do it all day long.

	This is two separate ideas, so it should be two sentences, with a space between the periods.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: I write quizzes about cats, rats, and rabbits.
options: I write quizzes about cats rats,and rabbits.
I write quizzes about cats, rats, and, rabbits.
I write quizzes about cats rats, and rabbits.
questions.explanation:
I write quizzes about cats, rats, and rabbits.

	Separate items in a list with a comma. There is disagreement about whether you need a comma after the word before 'and'.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: Quizmakers, like any other people, can make mistakes.
options: Quizmakers like any other people can make mistakes.
Quizmakers, like any other people can make mistakes.
Quizmakers like any other people, can make mistakes.
questions.explanation:
Quizmakers, like any other people, can make mistakes.

	The idea within the commas is a separate idea- a clause. If you took out the material between the commas, the sentence would still make sense.

questions.text: Which of the following is correct?
questions.correct: This quiz is great and educational.
options: Quiz is great.
Is great.
Is great and educational.
questions.explanation:
This quiz is great and educational.

	The others are sentence fragments.
